desc: The activities, actions, and policies used to gain and hold power in a government.
The group of people who officially control a country.
example: The government announced new reforms today.

desc: Laws or a set of laws made by a government.
example: The new legislation aims to reduce pollution.

desc: The process of voting to choose leaders or representatives.
example: Elections will be held next month.

desc: The highest law-making body in a country.
example: The law was passed by the parliament.

desc: A political system characterized by the presence of political parties.
example: The two-party system dominates politics in many countries.

desc: A system of government in which citizens vote to choose leaders or make decisions.
example: Democracy allows people to have a voice in government.

desc: A government where one person has total power and authority.
example: The country was ruled by a military dictatorship for years.

desc: A set of basic laws and principles that govern a country.
example: The constitution guarantees freedom of speech.

desc: Rules made by a government to maintain order and protect citizens.
